info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 8:57PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Eddy and west central Lea Counties through 945 PM MDT... At 857 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 23 miles northeast of Loving, or 28 miles east of Carlsbad, moving west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carlsbad, Avalon, Carlsbad North, Halfway, Lake Avalon, Otis, Cavern City Air Terminal and Living Desert State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
